column3: JPja
column4: USen

column3:
はぁ… はぁ…
正直 もうだめかと…
column4:
*pant pant* 
Frankly, I thought I was done for...

column3: しーっ…まだ魔物がいるみたい…
column4:
Shh! Looks like there are still some
monsters about...

column3:
あぁ このスリ傷… 
治るかしら…
column4: Ouch, this scratch... I hope it'll heal...

column3: イタタタ…ひどい目に遭いました
column4:
Ow! Owowowow... What a terrible thing
to have happen to me...

column3:
早く逃げましょう！
ガーディアンが こっちに来ます！
column4:
We've got to run! There's a Guardian
coming this way!

column3:
う～ん…あなたは男の人だし
ご興味あるかどうか…
要するに宝石の話なんですけれど
あまり ご興味ない？
では宝石はバカ高く売れると知ったら
どうかしら？
column4:
Hmm... I don't know how interested
you'd be to hear about this, really...

Oh, what the heck! I wanted to talk about
gems! Still interested? Maybe not, but...

What would you say if I told you that you
can sell gems at ridiculously high prices!
Interested now?

column3:
男の人でも宝石はバカ高く売れると知ったら…
そりゃ興味が湧くわよね
column4:
Even if the sight of gems doesn't spur
you to action, I'm sure the sight of what
they sell for will!

column3:
…あなた
双子山に行った事はおあり？
あの山は鉱石がたくさん採れますのよ！
ハンマーとか使って掘り当ててみたいわ！
そして…誰でもいいから
できるだけバカ高く売りつけたい！！
…ごめんなさい

宝石の美しさを思ったら
ついつい興奮しちゃいまして…
column4:
...Have you ever been to the
Dueling Peaks?

Those mountains are really rich in ore!
I want to get out there with a trusty
hammer and really mine up a fortune!
I can see it now... Big piles of gems
stacked neatly as far as the eye can see.
A buyer giving me tons of rupees...
Oh! Sorry... When I think about gems,
I just get so excited...

column3:
双子山では鉱石がたくさん採れますのよ！
鉱石は高く売れますし
私もハンマー持って掘り当に行こうかしら！
column4:
You can dig up a bunch of ore on 
Dueling Peaks! Now that I think about it,
I should use a hammer to mine that ore!

column3:
…もしかして あなた
カカリコ村に行きたいの？
それなら道なりに北に進みなさい

私も あの村にあるお店に
よく鉱石を売りつけに行くのよ
column4:
You wouldn't happen to be heading to
Kakariko Village, would you?

If you are, just follow the roads north.


That village is one of the places I
sell ore at, so I know the way
really well!

column3: カカリコ村は道なりに北に進むとあるわよ
column4:
To get to Kakariko Village, follow the
roads north.

column3:
う～ん…

あら ごめんなさい 
美しい妄想をしてたら ボーっとしちゃって…
妄想っていうのはね
ルビーとかサファイアのこと…
あの二種類は特に高く売れますのよ！
売っぱらって換金してこその宝石なのよッ！！
…ごめんなさい

宝石の美しさを思ったら
ついつい取り乱しちゃって…
column4:
...


Oh, yikes! I'm sorry! I was having such a
beautiful daydream, I was completely
zoned out...
Thinking about rubies and sapphires...


Those two gems can be sold at really
high prices! They're some of the best
gems to sell for serious money!!
...Sorry. I just get so carried away when
it comes to gems...

column3:
やっぱり宝石は換金してこそ！
ですわよね！！
特に高く売れるルビーとかサファイアは
持っていてるよりも断然お得ですものね！
column4:
The best way to realize a gem's true
value is by selling it! Rubies and
sapphires sell for a high price!
Better to sell than to hold on to them
until you're old and gray!

column3:
鉱石の価値は美しさと存在感にこそある…
いま私 そんなことを考えてたの
お金に換えればウッハウハっていうのは
本来の価値とは違うと思うのよね
鉱石をお金に換えてきて
ウッハウハの私が言うのも なんだけど…
column4:
A gem's value lies in its beauty... I was
just thinking about all the wonderful
gems I've seen!
And I was thinking about the glee I've
felt when I consider all the money one
can sell a beautiful gem for!
Not to brag, but I just made a few sales
and am feeling full of glee at
the moment...

column3:
美しさと存在感も大切だけど
それだけじゃあね…
やっぱり宝石はお金に換えてナンボよね…
column4:
Physically owning something as
beautiful as a gem is important, but...
money is nice, too.

column3: ♪朝はダイヤモンド～
column4: ♪Morn'n diamonds.♪

column3: ♪トパーズの日差し～
column4: ♪Sun rays of topaz.♪

column3: ♪ルビーよりルピー
column4: ♪Rupees over rubies.♪

column3: ♪星はサファイア～
column4: ♪Stars are sapphires.♪

column3: ♪オパールの雨～
column4: ♪It's raining opals.♪

column3:
…あなたのポーチ素敵だけど
鉱石を入れっぱなしにしたりしてない？
もしそうだとしたら
高く売れるのに宝の持ちぐされだなって
column4:
You've got a nice pouch for carrying
things, but are you carrying a lot of ore?

If you're just carrying it around, you're
missing out on a chance to make a
killing! Ore is valuable!

column3:
雨だと バクダン矢の火が消えちゃうから
使えなくなるんですってね
…なあに その顔
私って宝石以外の話しちゃいけないの？
column4:
When it's pouring rain, the fuses on
bomb arrows will go out, so they
won't explode.
What's with that look? Am I not allowed
to talk about something besides ore?

column3:
う～ん…

雨は私を無口にするのよね
column4:
...


Honestly, I don't feel much like talking
when it's all rainy out...

column3:
私ってね キラキラしたものが好き…
夜空の星…湖面の輝き…美しい宝石…
でも どれかひとつだけ選ぶとしたら
だんぜん宝石ね！
だって もし高値で売れば
キラキラしたお金が ガッポガポだもの！
私ってね キラキラしたものが好き…
column4:
I love pretty much everything that
sparkles... Stars in the night sky... The
shimmer off a lake... Gems...
Oh, gems, I'd pick you over everything
else!

...Because I can sell you at a high price
and be rolling in money!

*sigh* I love things that sparkle so much.

column3:
宝石のキラキラも大好きだけど
宝石を売って手に入るお金は
もっとキラキラしているの…
私って本当にキラキラしたものが好きみたい
column4:
I love the way a gem sparkles in the right
light, but the profits selling a gem can
bring also sparkle something wonderful.
I guess I just really love things
that sparkle.

column3:
…突然だけど ハンマーはお持ち？
鉱石集めに便利だって事 お伝えしておくわね
危険を承知で爆弾を使う人もいるけれど…
私の近くでドカンは やめてちょうだいね
column4:
I know this may seem a little random, but
have you got a hammer? It'll be helpful
to have one if you're gonna collect ore.
Some people use explosives instead,
though... It's really dangerous, but they
still do it.
Just... Please don't use explosives near
me, OK?

column3:
爆弾を使う人もいるみたいだけど…
鉱石集めには やっぱりハンマーよね
column4:
Some people use bombs... 
But hammers are the best for mining.

column3:
…道に迷ったんでしょ？
いいのいいの迷いは誰にでもあることよ
南に行けば双子馬宿"東に行けばハテノ村…
地図があるなら それ見て進めばいいだけ
でもね…
人生の地図って ないのよねぇ…
column4:
You're lost, aren't you? Oh, no, it's OK!
Everyone gets lost from time to time.

The Dueling Peaks Stable is to the south,
and Hateno Village is to the east. If you
have a map, look at it as you travel.
It's too bad there isn't a map to life,
you know?

column3:
南に行けば双子馬宿"東に行けばハテノ村…
地図があるなら それ見て進めばいいだけよ
column4:
The Dueling Peaks Stable is to the south,
and Hateno Village is to the east. Make
use of your map while you're traveling.

column3:
…あなた危険物の扱いは慣れてるほう？

この辺りには質の高い鉱石が多いし
豪快にドカーンと爆弾を使ってみたら？
ただし私の近くでやらないでちょうだいね
column4:
Have you got some experience handling
dangerous items? Like...bombs?

There's a ton of high-quality ore around
here, and bombs can be used to mine it
quickly. Plus, there'll be a cool explosion!
Just... Don't set the bombs off near
me, OK?

column3:
この辺りには質の高い鉱石が多いし
豪快にドカーンと爆弾を使ってみたら？
column4:
There's a lot of high-quality ore around
here... How about using a bomb to make
an exciting explosion?

column3:
私の頭の中って
鉱石や宝石や換金の事ばかり…
たまには他愛のない事でも考えてみようかしら
例えば…
温泉にトリのタマゴを入れると
「ゆでタマゴ」になる事とか…
column4:
I can't think about anything else... 
It's just ore and gems and making money
all the time...
Maybe I should try thinking about things
that can help others and not just my
wallet...
For example... Did you know you can put
a bird egg into a hot spring and you'll
make a hard-boiled egg? That's helpful!

column3:
なんだかお腹すいちゃったわ

温泉にトリのタマゴを入れて
「ゆでタマゴ」でも作ろうかな
column4:
My stomach is rumbling...
Maybe I'll put a bird egg into a 
hot spring to make a hard-boiled egg...

column3: もう魔物はいませんよね？ね？
column4: The monsters are gone, right? Right?

column3:
ふぅ…
なんとか逃げ切ることができました…
column4:
Phew... I managed to get away
somehow...

column3:
もうおしまいかと思ったけど
命拾いしましたわ！
column4:
I thought for sure I was done for, but I
somehow managed to narrowly
escape death!

column3:
なんて お強いんでしょう！
助けていただいたご恩は決して忘れません
column4:
Wow, you're really powerful! I'll never
forget that I owe you my life!

column3: あなたは私の命の恩人です！
column4: I owe you my life!

column3: あなたがいなかったら私は今ごろ…
column4:
If you hadn't shown up when you did,
right now I'd probably be... Well...

column3: これは感謝の気持ちです！
column4: This is to show my thanks!
